skill.name: project-scaffolder
skill.description: Creates plan.md, task.md, persona.md, project-context.md, and CLAUDE.md for new self-learning resource projects. Use when: (1) /init command is invoked, (2) setting up a new tutorial/guide/documentation project, (3) structure-designer agent needs templates for learning resource structure design. Provides hierarchical Part/Chapter/Section templates with page allocation.

skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: Pure template library with no executable code. Templates contain only placeholder variables for project scaffolding. The allowed-tools includes Bash unnecessarily for a read-only template skill, but no actual shell commands are executed by the skill itself.

medium_findings.title: Unnecessary Bash tool permission
medium_findings.description: The skill declares 'Bash' as an allowed tool (line 4 of SKILL.md), but templates contain no executable code. A pure template library does not need shell execution capabilities. This appears to be a templated permission set from a more complex plugin, not intentional capability requirement. Recommendation: Remove Bash from allowed-tools for a read-only template skill.

content.value_statement: Creating structured learning resources requires careful planning across multiple documents. This skill provides standardized templates for plan.md, task.md, persona.md, project-context.md, and CLAUDE.md, enabling consistent project organization with proper Part/Chapter/Section hierarchy.
actual_capabilities: Generates plan.md with hierarchical Part/Chapter/Section structure
Creates task.md with session-based progress tracking
Provides persona.md template for learner profile definitions
Builds project-context.md with environment and reference documentation
Creates CLAUDE.md for project-specific AI instructions
limitations: Requires manual population of placeholder variables
Does not execute or validate generated content
Cannot create actual document content, only templates
No built-in research or content generation capabilities

use_cases.title: Create structured tutorials
use_cases.description: Set up comprehensive technical tutorials with proper scope definition and learning objectives for students.

use_cases.title: Standardize project documentation
use_cases.description: Establish consistent documentation structure across multiple projects with aligned templates.

use_cases.title: Plan multi-part courses
use_cases.description: Design learning paths with clear progression from beginner to advanced topics across sessions.

prompt_templates.title: New tutorial project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the project-scaffolder skill to create templates for a Python beginner tutorial targeting developers new to programming. Target is 100 pages across 3 parts.

prompt_templates.title: Technical documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Scaffold a REST API documentation project using project-scaffolder. Include environment context for Node.js development and version compatibility information.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-session guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate templates for an advanced machine learning course. Design session boundaries for 200+ pages with 5 separate work sessions.

prompt_templates.title: Custom domain
prompt_templates.prompt: Scaffold a world history learning resource using project-scaffolder. Configure for history domain with appropriate terminology policies and citation conventions.

output_examples.input: Create project templates for a JavaScript fundamentals course covering 50 pages for beginner developers.
output: plan.md - Complete structure with 2 parts, 3 chapters, 8 sections
task.md - Session checklist with 3 work sessions
persona.md - Writer/reader personas with beginner-focused guidelines
project-context.md - JavaScript environment specifications and MDN references
CLAUDE.md - Project instructions for AI-assisted content generation

best_practices: Fill in all placeholder variables with specific project details before use
Align page allocations across plan.md and task.md for consistency
Group related sections within the same chapter for logical learning flow
anti_patterns: Using templates without defining clear learning objectives first
Skipping persona creation leads to inconsistent content tone
Ignoring session boundaries causes scope creep across work sessions

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works across all three platforms with identical template generation.

faq.question: What is the maximum project size?
faq.answer: Templates support any project size. Recommended maximum is 200+ pages across multiple sessions for practical management.

faq.question: Can I customize template structures?
faq.answer: Yes. Templates are markdown files that can be modified. Simply edit the template files before use or adapt generated outputs.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Safe. This skill only generates template files locally. No data is transmitted externally or stored beyond your project.

faq.question: Why are my generated files empty?
faq.answer: Templates contain placeholders that require manual filling. Check plan.md for placeholder format and fill variables like PROJECT_TITLE.

faq.question: How does this differ from writing prompts?
faq.answer: This skill scaffolds project structure only. Content generation requires the dokhak writer agent for actual document creation.
